author: Robin De Peyer
title: Pregnant British man to be first to give birth after finding sperm donor
text:
Sunday 8 January 2017 09:28 BST The man is due to give birth in five months (file image) Andrew Matthews/PA Wire 
A man has revealed he has become the first British male to get pregnant. 
Hayden Cross, 20, is legally male and is undergoing hormone treatment to complete his transition. 
The unemployed former supermarket worker is now four months pregnant using donor sperm to have a baby. 
He told The Sun on Sunday he found a donor using Facebook and put his transition from female to male on hold for a child. 
Mr Cross was born a girl and has lived as a man for three years, taking male hormones during the period. 
He said: "I want the baby to have the best. I’ll be the greatest dad." 
During the course of his transition, he had asked the NHS to freeze his eggs before the process was completed to allow him to have children later in life. 
But the NHS refused his request, prompting Mr Cross, from Gloucester, to use an anonymous sperm donor to go ahead with his pregnancy. 
After giving birth, he says he plans to continue immediately with his transition process to remove his breasts and ovaries. 
"I faced the prospect of not becoming the man I am supposed to be, physically, or a dad," he told The Sun on Sunday. 
"So I didn’t feel like I had any choice but to have a baby now then get back to transitioning." 
But he admitted the process is difficult and has caused him discomfort. 
"I found I was pregnant two weeks after the sperm was inserted. 
"It was mixed emotions. 
"I was happy but I also knew it would be backtracking on my transition. 
"It’s like I have given myself one thing, but taken away something else from myself in the meantime. 
"It is a very female thing to carry a baby and it goes against everything I feel in my body. 
"I was finally starting to become myself and become a man physically — but now my body is going in the opposite direction. 
"It makes me angry that I’ve been put through this. 
"Carrying a baby is meant to be a happy time, but in my body it feels wrong. 
"I just couldn’t face being years down the line and still waiting to transition so that I can have a kid. 
"I wanted the kid now so that I can have the transition before I get old. 
"I want to enjoy being the way I was meant to be." 
The world's first pregnant man was Thomas Beatie, from Arizona in the US. He gave birth in 2008 after commencing hormone treatment to become a man but keeping his reproductive organs. More about:
